arr.Name: Adalbert Waffling
arr.Description: Famous magical theoretician.

arr.Name: Alberic Grunnion
arr.Description:
This nineteenth-century wizard
invented the Dungbomb.

arr.Name: Alberta Toothill
arr.Description:
Winner of the All-England Wizarding
Duelling Competition of 1430.
Famously overcame the favourite,
Samson Wiblin, with a Blasting Curse.

arr.Name: Albus Dumbledore
arr.Description:
Considered by many the greatest
wizard of modern times,Professor Dumbledore
is particularly famous for his defeat
of the dark wizard Grindelwald in 1945,
for the discovery of the twelve uses of
dragon’s blood and his work on alchemy with his
partner, Nicolas Flamel. Professor Dumbledore
enjoys chamber music and tenpin bowling.

arr.Name: Albus Dumbledore 2
arr.Description:
Considered by many the greatest
wizard of modern times,Professor Dumbledore
is particularly famous for his defeat
of the dark wizard Grindelwald in 1945,
for the discovery of the twelve uses of
dragon’s blood and his work on alchemy with his
partner, Nicolas Flamel. Professor Dumbledore
enjoys chamber music and tenpin bowling.

arr.Name: Almeric Sawbridge
arr.Description:
Famous for conquering the
river troll that was terrorising
those trying to cross the Wye River.
River troll in question believed to
be one of the largest ever
to exist in Britain
with a weight of one tonne.

arr.Name: Andros the Invincible
arr.Description:
Alleged to have been the only known
wizard to produce a Patronus the size of a giant.

arr.Name: Archibald Alderton
arr.Description:
Famous for blowing up a hamlet of Little Dropping,
Hampshire whilst attempting to magically mix a birthday cake.

arr.Name: Artemisia Lufkin
arr.Description:
In 1798 Artemisia Lufkin was the
first witch to become Minister for Magic.

arr.Name: Balfour Blane
arr.Description: Established the Committee on Experimental Charms.

arr.Name: Beatrix Bloxam
arr.Description:
Author of the Toadstool Tales, a series of
childrens' books since banned because they
have been found to cause nausea and vomiting.

arr.Name: Beatrix Bloxam 2
arr.Description:
Author of the Toadstool Tales, a series of
childrens' books since banned because they
have been found to cause nausea and vomiting.

arr.Name: Beaumont Marjoribanks
arr.Description:
Pioneer of Herbology and collector
of many rare and magical flowers.
Discovered Gillyweed.

arr.Name: Bertie Bott
arr.Description:
Inventor of Bertie Bott's
Every Flavour Beans.

arr.Name: Blenheim Stalk
arr.Description:
Muggle expert and author of many books
including 'Muggles Who Notice.'
a study of muggle awareness of magic.

arr.Name: Bowman Wright
arr.Description: Famous for developing the Golden Snitch.

arr.Name: Bowman Wright 2
arr.Description: Famous for developing the Golden Snitch.

arr.Name: Bridget Wenlock
arr.Description:
Famous Arithmancer. First to establish
the magical properties of the number seven.

arr.Name: Burdock Muldoon
arr.Description: Chief of Wizards' Council 1448-50.

arr.Name: Carlotta Pinkstone
arr.Description:
Famous campaigner for lifting the
International Confederation of Wizard’s
Statute of Secrecy and telling
Muggle folks that wizards still exist.
Ms. Pinkstone has been imprisoned several
times for her blatant and deliberate
use of magic in public places.

arr.Name: Cassandra Vablatsky
arr.Description:
Celebrated Seer and author
of 'Unfogging the Future'.

arr.Name: Celestina Warbeck
arr.Description: Popular singing sorceress.

arr.Name: Chauncey Oldridge
arr.Description: First known victim of Dragon Pox.

arr.Name: Circe
arr.Description:
Witch who lived on
Island of Aeaea. Expert at
turning lost sailors into pigs.

arr.Name: Cornelius Agrippa
arr.Description:
Agrippa was a celebrated wizard
imprisoned by Muggles for his writings.

arr.Name: Crispin Cronk
arr.Description:
Sent to Azkaban for continuing to
keep Sphinxes in his back garden
despite repeated warnings.

arr.Name: Crispin Cronk 2
arr.Description:
Sent to Azkaban for continuing to
keep Sphinxes in his back garden
despite repeated warnings.

arr.Name: Cyprian Youdle
arr.Description:
Only Quidditch referee ever to die
during a match.
The originator of the curse was never
caught but believed to have
been a member of the crowd.

arr.Name: Daisy Dodderidge
arr.Description:
Daisy Dodderidge built the Leaky Cauldron
to serve as a gateway between the Muggle world
and Diagon Alley. Wizards and witches
of her day loved her generosity and
the welcoming atmosphere of her pub.

arr.Name: Derwent Shimpling
arr.Description:
Ate an entire Venomous Tentacula
on a bet and survived,
though is still purple.

arr.Name: Devlin Whitehorn
arr.Description:
Founder of the Nimbus
racing broom company.

arr.Name: Donaghan Tremlett
arr.Description:
Bass player with the popular wizarding
band The Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Dorcas Wellbeloved
arr.Description: Founder of the Society for Distressed Witches.

arr.Name: Dorcas Wellbeloved 2
arr.Description: Founder of the Society for Distressed Witches.

arr.Name: Dunbar Oglethorpe
arr.Description:
Chief of Q.U.A.B.B.L.E.
(Quidditch Union for the
Administration and Betterment
of the British League
and its Endeavours).

arr.Name: Dunbar Oglethorpe 2
arr.Description:
Chief of Q.U.A.B.B.L.E.
(Quidditch Union for the
Administration and Betterment
of the British League
and its Endeavours).

arr.Name: Dymphna Furmage
arr.Description:
Famously abducted by pixies while on
holiday in Cornwall and lived in
mortal dread of them thereafter.
Failed to persuade the Ministry of Magic
to have all pixies humanely destroyed.

arr.Name: Dzou Yen
arr.Description: Chinese alchemist.

arr.Name: Edgar Stroulger
arr.Description: Inventor of the Sneakoscope.

arr.Name: Edgar Stroulger 2
arr.Description: Inventor of the Sneakoscope.

arr.Name: Elfrida Clagg
arr.Description: Chieftaness of Warlock's Council.

arr.Name: Elfrida Clagg 2
arr.Description: Chieftaness of Warlock's Council.

arr.Name: Elladora Ketteridge
arr.Description:
Witch who discovered the use of Gillyweed
when she nearly suffocated after eating it
and recovered only when she
stuck her head into a bucket of water.

arr.Name: Ethelred the Ever-Ready
arr.Description:
Famous for taking offence at nothing and
cursing innocent bystanders. Died in Gaol.

arr.Name: Ethelred the Ever-Ready 2
arr.Description:
Famous for taking offence at nothing and
cursing innocent bystanders. Died in Gaol.

arr.Name: Falco Aesalon
arr.Description:
The first recorded example of an Animagus,
he could transform himself into a falcon.

arr.Name: Felix Summerbee
arr.Description: Inventor of Cheering Charms.

arr.Name: Flavius Belby
arr.Description:
Flavius Belby wrote the earliest
known account of a Lethifold after he
survived an attack whilst holidaying
in Papua New Guinea in 1782.

arr.Name: Fulbert the Fearful
arr.Description:
Famous for being so cowardly
he never ventured out of his house.
Died when a Defensive Charm backfired
and the roof fell in.

arr.Name: Fulbert the Fearful 2
arr.Description:
Famous for being so cowardly
he never ventured out of his house.
Died when a Defensive Charm backfired
and the roof fell in.

arr.Name: Gaspard Shingleton
arr.Description:
Celebrated inventor of the
Self-Stirring Cauldron.

arr.Name: Gideon Crumb
arr.Description:
Plays bagpipes with the popular
wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Gifford Ollerton
arr.Description:
Famous giant-slayer, killed the
giant Hengist of Upper Barnton.

arr.Name: Glanmore Peakes
arr.Description: Famous slayer of the Sea Serpent of Cromer.

arr.Name: Glanmore Peakes 2
arr.Description: Famous slayer of the Sea Serpent of Cromer.

arr.Name: Glenda Chittock
arr.Description:
Popular presenter of the W.W.N.
(Wizarding Wireless Network)
programme Witching Hour.

arr.Name: Glover Hipworth
arr.Description:
Inventor of the Pepperup Potion,
cure for the common cold.

arr.Name: Godric Gryffindor
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave his name to one of
the four Hogwarts houses.

arr.Name: Godric Gryffindor 2
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave his name to one of
the four Hogwarts houses.

arr.Name: Gondoline Oliphant
arr.Description:
Famous for studies of
life and habits of trolls.
Clubbed to death in the Cotswolds
while sketching.

arr.Name: Gregory the Smarmy
arr.Description:
Famous originator of Gregory's Unctuous Unction
potion to persuade the drinker that the giver
is their very best friend.
Alleged to have wormed his way into
King Richard's confidence and
thus made his fortune.

arr.Name: Greta Catchlove
arr.Description: Author of 'Charm Your Own Cheese'.

arr.Name: Grogan Stump
arr.Description: Popular Minister for Magic, appointed 1811.

arr.Name: Grogan Stump 2
arr.Description: Popular Minister for Magic, appointed 1811.

arr.Name: Gulliver Pokeby
arr.Description:
Expert on magical birds.
First to identify meaning of Augurey song.

arr.Name: Gunhilda of Gorsemoor
arr.Description:
One-eyed, hump-backed witch
famous for developing a cure for Dragon pox.

arr.Name: Gunhilda of Gorsemoor 2
arr.Description:
One-eyed, hump-backed witch
famous for developing a cure for Dragon pox.

arr.Name: Gwenog Jones
arr.Description:
Captain and Beater of the all-female
national Quidditch team, the Holyhead Harpies.

arr.Name: Gwenog Jones 2
arr.Description:
Captain and Beater of the all-female
national Quidditch team, the Holyhead Harpies.

arr.Name: Harry Potter
arr.Description: The boy who lived.

arr.Name: Harry Potter 2
arr.Description: The boy who lived.

arr.Name: Havelock Sweeting
arr.Description:
Unicorn expert. Helped set up unicorn
reservations throughout Britain.

arr.Name: Heathcote Barbary
arr.Description:
Plays rhythm guitar with the popular
wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Helga Hufflepuff
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave her name to one of
the four Hogwarts houses.

arr.Name: Helga Hufflepuff 2
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave her name to one of
the four Hogwarts houses.

arr.Name: Hengist of Woodcroft
arr.Description:
Founder of the village of
Hogsmeade in Scotland

arr.Name: Herman Wintringham
arr.Description:
Plays lute with the popular
wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Herpo the Foul
arr.Description: First known creator of the basilisk.

arr.Name: Hesper Starkey
arr.Description:
Hesper Starkey studied the
use of phases of the moon
in potion-making.

arr.Name: Hesper Starkey 2
arr.Description:
Hesper Starkey studied the
use of phases of the moon
in potion-making.

arr.Name: Honoria Nutcombe
arr.Description:
Founded the Society for
the Reformation of Hags.

arr.Name: Honoria Nutcombe 2
arr.Description:
Founded the Society for
the Reformation of Hags.

arr.Name: Ignatia Wildsmith
arr.Description:
Ignatia Wildsmith was a
wizarding inventor and the
creator of Floo powder.

arr.Name: Ignatia Wildsmith 2
arr.Description:
Ignatia Wildsmith was a
wizarding inventor and the
creator of Floo powder.

arr.Name: Jocunda Sykes
arr.Description:
Famous for flying across the Atlantic
on a broomstick
the first person to do so.

arr.Name: Jocunda Sykes 2
arr.Description:
Famous for flying across the Atlantic
on a broomstick
the first person to do so.

arr.Name: Joscelind Wadcock
arr.Description:
Chaser for Puddlemere United Quidditch team.
Record for highest number of goals
during British season this century.

arr.Name: Joscelind Wadcock 2
arr.Description:
Chaser for Puddlemere United Quidditch team.
Record for highest number of goals
during British season this century.

arr.Name: Justus Pilliwickle
arr.Description:
Celebrated Head of the Department
of Magical Law Enforcement.

arr.Name: Kirley Duke
arr.Description:
Plays lead guitar with the
popular wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Laverne de Montmorency
arr.Description: Inventor of many Love Potions.

arr.Name: Leopoldina Smethwyck
arr.Description:
Leopoldina was the first British
witch to referee a Quidditch match.

arr.Name: Merlin
arr.Description:
Merlin is the most famous wizard
of all time. He is sometimes known as
the Prince of Enchanters and was
part of the Court of King Arthur.

arr.Name: Merton Graves
arr.Description:
Plays cello with the popular
wizarding band The Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Merwyn the Malicious
arr.Description:
Merwyn the Malicious was a medieval wizard
credited with the invention of many
unpleasant jinxes and hexes.

arr.Name: Mirabella Plunkett
arr.Description:
Famous for falling in love with a merman
in Loch Lomond while on holiday.
When her parents forbade her to marry him,
she transfigured herself into a haddock
and was never seen again.

arr.Name: Mirabella Plunkett 2
arr.Description:
Famous for falling in love with a merman
in Loch Lomond while on holiday.
When her parents forbade her to marry him,
she transfigured herself into a haddock
and was never seen again.

arr.Name: Miranda Goshawk
arr.Description:
Miranda Goshawk is the author of
The Standard Book of Spells series,
which are set textbooks for the
students of Hogwarts.

arr.Name: Montague Knightley
arr.Description: Wizard's Chess Champion.

arr.Name: Mopsus
arr.Description:
Soothsayer who vanquished the
Seer Calchas in a contest of their powers.

arr.Name: Morgan le Fay
arr.Description:
King Arthur's half sister.
Dark sorceress. Enemy of Merlin.

arr.Name: Morgan le Fay 2
arr.Description:
King Arthur's half sister.
Dark sorceress. Enemy of Merlin.

arr.Name: Mungo Bonham
arr.Description:
Famous wizard healer.
Founded Saint Mungo's Hospital
for Magical Ailments and Injuries.

arr.Name: Mungo Bonham 2
arr.Description:
Famous wizard healer.
Founded Saint Mungo's Hospital
for Magical Ailments and Injuries.

arr.Name: Musidora Barkwith
arr.Description:
Composer of the unfinished Wizarding Suite,
which features an exploding tuba.
Its performance has been banned since
its last performance in 1902, when it
blew the roof out of Ackerley Town Hall.

arr.Name: Myron Wagtail
arr.Description:
Lead singer of popular
wizarding band the Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Newt Scamander
arr.Description:
Celebrated author of
'Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them'.

arr.Name: Norvel Twonk
arr.Description:
Died saving a Muggle child
from a runaway Manticore.
Posthumously awarded the
Order of Merlin, First Class.

arr.Name: Norvel Twonk 2
arr.Description:
Died saving a Muggle child
from a runaway Manticore.
Posthumously awarded the
Order of Merlin, First Class.

arr.Name: Orsino Thruston
arr.Description:
Plays drums with the popular
wizarding band the Weird Sisters.

arr.Name: Oswald Beamish
arr.Description: Pioneer of Goblin rights.

arr.Name: Oswald Beamish 2
arr.Description: Pioneer of Goblin rights.

arr.Name: Paracelsus
arr.Description:
Contemporary of Copernicus and Leonardo Da Vinci,
a medical genius whose bold theories
Challenged medieval thought.
Credited with discovering Parseltongue.

arr.Name: Perpetua Fancourt
arr.Description: Witch who invented the Lunascope.

arr.Name: Quong Po
arr.Description:
Chinese wizard who discovered
the uses of powered fireball eggs.

arr.Name: Roderick Plumpton
arr.Description:
Seeker for the English Quidditch Team.
Holds British record for fastest
capture of Snitch during game:
three and a half seconds.

arr.Name: Roderick Plumpton 2
arr.Description:
Seeker for the English Quidditch Team.
Holds British record for fastest
capture of Snitch during game:
three and a half seconds.

arr.Name: Roland Kegg
arr.Description: President of English Gobstones Team.

arr.Name: Rowena Ravenclaw
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave her name to one of
the four Hogwarts houses.

arr.Name: Rowena Ravenclaw 2
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave her name to one of
the four Hogwarts houses.

arr.Name: Sacharissa Tugwood
arr.Description:
Pioneer of Beautifying Potions.
Discovered the pimple-curing
properties of Bubotuber Pus.

arr.Name: Sacharissa Tugwood 2
arr.Description:
Pioneer of Beautifying Potions.
Discovered the pimple-curing
properties of Bubotuber Pus.

arr.Name: Salazar Slytherin
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave his name to one of
the four Hogwarts Houses.

arr.Name: Salazar Slytherin 2
arr.Description:
Co-founder of Hogwarts.
Gave his name to one of
the four Hogwarts Houses.

arr.Name: Lord Stoddard Withers
arr.Description: Breeder of flying horses.

arr.Name: Thaddeus Thurkell
arr.Description:
Famous for producing seven Squib
sons and turning them all
into hedgehogs in disgust.

arr.Name: Thaddeus Thurkell 2
arr.Description:
Famous for producing seven Squib
sons and turning them all
into hedgehogs in disgust.

arr.Name: Tilly Toke
arr.Description:
Gained Order of Merlin, First Class
for saving Muggle lives during the
Ilfracombe Incident of 1932,
when a dragon swooped down on a
beach full of sunbathers.

arr.Name: Uric the Oddball
arr.Description:
Highly eccentric wizard who
is famed, among other things,
for wearing a jellyfish for a hat.

arr.Name: Wendelin the Weird
arr.Description:
Alleged to have enjoyed being burnt
at the stake so much that she
allowed herself to be captured
fourteen times in various
disguises.

arr.Name: Wendelin the Weird 2
arr.Description:
Alleged to have enjoyed being burnt
at the stake so much that she
allowed herself to be captured
fourteen times in various
disguises.

arr.Name: Wilfred Elphick
arr.Description: First wizard to be gored by an African Erumpent.

arr.Name: Wilfred Elphick 2
arr.Description: First wizard to be gored by an African Erumpent.

arr.Name: Xavier Rastrick
arr.Description:
Flamboyant wizard entertainer
who vanished unexpectedly while tapdancing
to a crowd of three hundred
in Painswick and was never
seen again.

arr.Name: Yardley Platt
arr.Description: Serial goblin-killer.
